title: What is the relationship between mesmerism, hypnotism, and suggestion? How have scientists changed their views on the subject over time, and what is the difference between animal magnetism and other related branches? What are some real-life examples of innovators who were initially accused of charlatanism but later received recognition for their contributions to science? How do the author's experiments with fascination differ from traditional ideas of hypnotism, and what new discoveries have been made in this area of study?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens, the author reflects on the state of magnetism, also known as hypnotism or fascination, and its various branches such as somnambulism and lucidness. He discusses the confusion and misunderstandings surrounding the topic and the difficulty in distinguishing between real and simulated effects. The author also challenges the theory of hypnotism and its supposed separation from magnetism. He shares his personal experience with fascination and his ability to control people's actions without inducing sleep. The author suggests that the word "hypnotism" is often used as a convenient veil for those who want to distance themselves from the original magnetism.
content: Les savants reviennent au magnétisme qu’ils avaient conspué, mais ils l’appellent hypnotisme, pour sauver les apparences et ne point sembler devoir abjurer leur erreur. Braid ayant inventé une méthode, a cru utile de lui appliquer un nom spécial, ce en quoi il a sagement agi, car pour désigner les choses nouvelles il faut des mots nouveaux (Mais son mot ne vaut rien!) Et puis un mot nouveau peut servir de voile si commode aux consciences tourmentées. C’est sous le voile de Y hypnotisme que le magnétisme a fait une rentrée triomphante dans le monde savant dont on, l’avait ignominieusement expulsé. L’hypnotisme est plutôt un voile faussement scientifique qu’une science nouvelle. Les expériences de fascination que j’ai l’honneur de vous soumettre s'éloignent bien plus du magnét sme, du somnambulisme que l’hypnotisme n’en diffère. Je supprime le sommeil, que les procédés hypnotiques produisent comme les procédés magnétiques. J’oblige une personne évidemment éveillée à m’obéir en tout. Au milieu d’une conversation, j’arrête le mot qui va sortir de ses lèvres. Si elle veut rester en place, je l’oblige à marcher. Sicile désire marcher, je la rends immobile. Elle ne dort pas cependant. Scs idées sont très nettes. Et voilà que soudain je lui fais oublier son nom. Et quoique ayant oublié son propre nom, elle a gardé pleine conscience de ses actes.
last_phrase: In conclusion, despite the controversy and skepticism that surrounded mesmerism and hypnotism, the persistence and experimentation of sincere practitioners has led to a deeper understanding of the human mind and potential for suggestion. The sensitivity to magnetic influence is not limited to the sick or uneducated, but can exist in individuals from all walks of life. We may never fully understand the mysteries of mesmerism and hypnotism, but we owe it to those who dared to explore the unknown to continue to pursue a more complete understanding of the human psyche. The passing of Louis Simonin and Claude-Marie-François-Adrien Varinard des Côtes represents a loss to the field of science and journalism, but their contributions will continue to inspire future generations of thinkers and experimenters.
